titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Social Science Libraries and Information Services, Yale University, Records
Social Science Libraries and Information Services, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:41

did.unittitle: Social Science Libraries and Information Services, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist annual reports and statistics of the Social Science Library from 1969-1997 as well as correspondence, memoranda, reports, proposals, and committee files of Sandra K. Peterson, Director of the Social Science Libraries and Information Services. The records document the various libraries and collections of the Social Science Libraries and Information Services, including the Social Science Library, Seeley G. Mudd Library, Statistics Library, Government Documents and Information Center, and Economic Growth Center Collection.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale University. Social Science Libraries and Information Services

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 32-D (YRG 32-D), Records of Yale school and department libraries and collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were transferred from the Social Science Libraries and Information Services, 2007 and 2015.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the records is restricted. See Collection Contents for details.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Social Science Libraries and Information Services, Yale University, Records (RU 1025). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by topic.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist annual reports and statistics of the Social Science Library from 1969-1997 as well as correspondence, memoranda, reports, proposals, and committee files of Sandra K. Peterson, Director of the Social Science Libraries and Information Services. The records document the various libraries and collections of the Social Science Libraries and Information Services, including the Social Science Library, Seeley G. Mudd Library, Statistics Library, Government Documents and Information Center, and Economic Growth Center Collection.

did.unittitle: Records of Sandra K. Peterson as Director of the Social Science Libraries, Yale University
Administrative records of the Social Science Library
Social Science Data Archive (SSDA)-History and Development
Grant proposal, background information, budget, final report-- Forum on Geographic Information systems and the Impact for Libraries
Biological, Social, Industrial and Cultural History of the Chicken through Print, Image, and Word
Exhibit tags, publicity materials, correspondence related to "chicken" exhibit
Map Resources Group: Reports and documentation
Public Printing Task Force: Reports, background information, vendor proposals, meeting records
Reference Services Group: Grant proposal, final report, background information
Science Park Patent Depository Library Committee: Reports, minutes, publications
Serials Management Task Force: Reports, statistics, procedures, policies
Service Quality Improvement Council: Charge, documentation of issues (Problem patron) (most info on web site)
Inventory of Mexican State Statistical vol.
Govt. Doc. Advisory Group/Coll. Dev. Subcommittee
Correspondence w/govt. officials about U.S. Federal depository program
United Nations Scholars' Workstation-history and development
Govt. Information class for adm. & tech. Support staff, SCOPA grant proposal, documentation, final report

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: In accordence with university policy, these records are restricted until January 1, 2032.
